str2: Elijah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Helias, an Israelite.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To talk with, discuss. From sun and laleo; to talk together, i.e. Converse.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
